headline: A man let snakes bite him 202 times. His blood helped create a new antivenom
context: To build immunity to bites from venomous snakes like this water cobra, Tim Friede injected himself with doses of venom over time.

annotations.paragraph: Tim Friede remembers his worst snakebites in screaming detail.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a personal anecdote but lacks new information about the main story.

annotations.paragraph: The first was from an Egyptian cobra. The second, an hour later, from a monocled cobra. Both bites occurred at his home in Wisconsin. Both were from highly venomous snakes. Neither bite was an accident.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the snakebites, contributing to the narrative of the main story.

annotations.paragraph: Friede let the cobras bite him on purpose ­­— now, he’s logged 202 snakebites, in total.
annotations.reason: This paragraph directly relates to the headline by summarizing Friede's actions and their significance.
